critique: The document discusses an amendment to Schedule A of positions excepted from examination under civil-service rules. It adds a new clause, 12, to Subdivision XVIII, which pertains to chauffeurs-truck drivers, elevator operators, guards, messengers, and telephone operators for the national homes. According to the amendment, the Veterans' Administration can employ members of the homes to fill these positions if they can satisfactorily perform the duties. If the positions are filled otherwise, civil-service rules and regulations must be followed. The document was issued by [NAME] from The White House on September 22, 1931.
